item.name: Artevil Suspension
entries: This dried herb is known for its ability to draw toxins from the body, albeit violently. You can administer the suspension orally, {@action Activate an Item||Activating} the item as part of the same activity you use to {@action Treat Poison}. If you succeed at your {@skill Medicine} check to {@action Treat Poison} against an ingested poison, you can reduce the stage of the toxin by one stage, though this can't reduce the stage below stage 1 or cure the poison entirely. If you do, the creature becomes {@condition sickened} 2 as its body purges the toxin. An artevil suspension doesn't work unless the poison was administered through ingestion; for instance, if a poison can be administered through either ingestion or injury and was administered through injury, the suspension won't work.

item.name: Curled Cure Gel
entries: Curled cure secretes a gel that gently warms the skin and stimulates healing. You can {@action Activate an Item||Activate the item} as part of the same activity you use to {@action Treat Wounds}. If you successfully {@action Treat Wounds}, you can also reduce the value of one of the targets' {@condition clumsy}, {@condition enfeebled}, or {@condition stupefied} conditions by 1. The target of your {@action Treat Wounds} is then temporarily immune to curled cure gel for 24 hours, whether or not your attempt to {@action Treat Wounds} was successful

item.name: Drowsy Sun Eye Drops
entries: These drops are made from luminescent mushrooms and refined into eye drops, which simulates a creature's natural night vision. When you attempt a {@skill Perception} check to {@action Seek}, you can draw and apply a dose of drowsy sun to your eyes as part of the same action, which grants you {@ability darkvision} to a range of 30 feet for 1 round. If you do, your {@action Seek} action gains the {@trait manipulate} trait, due to drawing and applying the eye drops.

item.name: Lady's Blessing Oil
entries: Lady's blessing oil is favored by Pharasmin healers who ease the transitions of life. You can {@action Activate an Item||Activate the item} as part of the same activity you use to {@action Administer First Aid} to stabilize a creature. If you use lady's blessing oil, the DC of the check to {@action Administer First Aid} is reduced to the creature's recovery roll DC, rather than 5 + the recovery roll DC. However, if you roll a failure on the check, you get a critical failure instead.

item.name: Toothwort Extract

activate.trigger: You use {@action Quick Alchemy} to craft an {@filter alchemical poison|items||item=alchemical;poison} that's at least 1 level lower than your advanced alchemy level.

entries: Originally used in dental procedures, toothwort numbs the gums by deadening nerves. When the oils are extracted and distilled, toothwort has a secondary reputation among alchemists for enhancing the duration of poisons. When adding toothwort extract to an {@filter alchemical poison|items||item=alchemical;poison}, you can extend the maximum duration of the poison by 1 round.

item.name: Yarrow-Root Bandage
entries: This root is often infused into bandages for life-threatening bleeding. {@action Activate an Item||Activating the item} is part of the same activity you use to {@action Administer First Aid} to stop bleeding on a creature who's also {@condition dying}. When you do, you can {@action Administer First Aid} to stop bleeding and {@condition dying} as part of the same activity with only one {@skill Medicine} check. However, the DC for the {@skill Medicine} check is equal to the 5 + the higher of the two DCs to {@action Administer First Aid}.
